page.title: 02Shepreth Parish Council
page.content: The Parish Council is the level of local government dealing with matters concerning just one parish. Their funds are allocated from the rates. The number of members depends on the size of the parish but in the case of the size of Shepreth there are seven members. There are eight meetings of the committee and one open village meeting per year. The annual village meeting is open to members of the public so that they can speak, the public can attend other meetings but cannot speak. They look after the general facilities of the village such as recreation ground, bus shelters, seats, footpaths, and control land as recreation ground, memorial, school field, church pits, allotments and meadows.
